title: How to Fix a Grey Screen on Discord: 10 Troubleshooting Tips

steps.title: Make sure Discord is up-to-date.
steps.content: Make sure Discord is up-to-date. The recent update has solved the grey screen issue for most users. Discord updates automatically , so make sure you're connected to a stable Wi-Fi network when you boot up Discord.

steps.title: Close Discord fully and launch it again.
steps.content: Close Discord fully and launch it again. Make sure you aren't just minimizing the program. Find it in the system tray, right-click it, and then click Quit Discord . You can also close Discord via the Task Manager .

steps.title: Press Ctrl+R.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + R . This is the keyboard shortcut to reload pages or programs. Make sure Discord is selected as the main window, and then press the keyboard shortcut. Discord should refresh and reload.

steps.title: Press F5.
steps.content: Press F5 . If Discord didn't reload with the previous method, use F5 to refresh all the content on the entire screen.

The cache could contain corrupted data that prevents Discord from loading properly. If you're using a computer, you'll need to delete the app data folder in your system files. Windows : Open the File Explorer. Type %appdata%\discord into the file path box. Press Enter . Right-click and delete the Cache , Code Cache , and GPUCache folders. Mac : Open the Finder. Click Go > Go to Folder at the top. Type ~/Library/Application Support/discord/ into the text box. Press Enter/Return . Right-click and delete the Cache , Code Cache , and GPUCache folders.
If you're able to get into Discord temporarily, disable Hardware Acceleration while you can. Do the following: Click the cog icon. Click Advanced . Toggle off Hardware Acceleration .

steps.title: If the desktop app is buggy, try using https://discord.com/.
steps.content: If the desktop app is buggy, try using https://discord.com/ . While only a temporary fix, this can be helpful if you need to use Discord immediately.

steps.title: Make sure you have a stable internet connection.
steps.content: Make sure you have a stable internet connection. If you're getting a grey screen on Discord, it could be that you're fully connecting to Discord's servers. Verify your connection, and if needed, troubleshoot your network .

steps.title: Check for any driver updates.
steps.content: Check for any driver updates. Other aspects of your computer can affect how certain apps work. Find and update your drivers in Update & Security and Windows Device Manager (Windows) or in the App Store (Mac).

steps.title: Make sure all systems are online.
steps.content: Make sure all systems are online. In some cases, Discord may have a system outage that can affect its performance on your device. You can check if all systems are operational at https://discordstatus.com/ . [1] X Research source
